By Trickster on Saturday, September 29, 2001 - 08:21 am:

Same note here as on the Depleting Items page, but just as a note, I haven't yet put up various items I've found that are available to buy, since I'm not sure if they're available for use by *any* type of monster, or only one or a few of the breeds. I can start plugging them in, though, if people would rather see them, even if we're not sure yet which breeds they might fit.

As another note, on "mask," I have "Any(?)" listed as the breed. To qualify this, it seems that you could probably buy (or be given) this item for any breed, but once you are given it for one breed (and probably the same for buying it), it's only usable by that breed, so far as I can tell.

And I have *no* clue about any of the effects so far, which is why I forgot to add that part of the table yet. ;)

If you have more items info to add to the chart, post it here, and a moderator will add it in & give you credit!

By Eagle Fierce on Saturday, December 29, 2001 - 03:46 pm:

"Horn Badge" is a Lesione item won in a specific D class battle, and "Ribbon" is for a Mew, I believe. The "Mask" is to place pictures on with the use of the Sony Printshop.

I'm not certain about this, but I THINK that the "Breast Plate" designed for the Raiden species acts like an artificial "Tough Skin," but it doesn't GIVE the monster that characteristic, just the full effects. Meaning less damage by hits and more difficulty dodging. I'm not really certain how to properly test this, but it seemed to work for me in the latter tournaments.

Ave. Damage by Durahan w/out Breast Plate = Approx. 94HP
Ave. Damage by Durahan with Breat Plate = Approx. 72HP

Anybody is free to prove me wrong, since it's not really scientific law or anything.

By Ocman on Sunday, January 13, 2002 - 12:20 pm:

Is there any way to increase the amount of "item points" on your monsters from 120? I have a dragon and have purchased both the bat breast plate and the bat tail piece but I am unable to put both on at the same time. How anoying. Because it would look realy cool if ya could.

By torey luvullo on Sunday, January 13, 2002 - 02:07 pm:

if there is i havent found it yet.

By Eagle Fierce on Monday, January 14, 2002 - 01:24 pm:

Another one that I'm unsure about, but testing seemed semi-accurate, and it makes sense.

My Pashminer had an item that was a spiked balls of sorts. When equipped on the tail, I THINK I noticed a slight increase in damage when using attacks that revolve around utilization of the tail (Tail Attack and Tail Lash (?...the one where it spins in the air and somersaults into a tail attack) for example)). I believe it costs 40 Accessory Points to equip this item.

BTW, in my previous post, I stated that "Ribbon" was for Mew, but I was wrong. "Ribbon" is for Suzurin and "White Ribbon" is for Mew. Just wanted to correct myself. ^_^

By koosen on Tuesday, January 15, 2002 - 01:54 pm:

To help out, here is info i have for the accessories i have thus far obtained.

(Suezo)
Knuckles:80/all/tail/An iron fist used to break massive rocks.

(Momo)
Parasol:80/all/head/A large parasol. Blocks harmful UV rays.

(Golem)
Helmet(1):60/all/head/A somewhat heavy helmet.
Stone Shield:80/G,T,K,M/arms/A very heavy shield made of stone.

(Zoom)
Fang Ornament:50/all/body/An amulet made of fangs.

(Mew)
Ribbon:80/all/body/A large ribbon with bells attached.

(Lesione)
Horn Badge:80/G,K/head/A forehead ornament that makes one look a little stronger.

(Suzurin)
Brooch:60/all/body/A simple, yet beautiful brooch.
White Ribbon:60/B,G,K,M/body/A cute, white ribbon.

(Psiroller)
Ukulele:80/B,G,K,M/body/It is said to make beautiful sounds.

(Mogi)
Sheriff Star:80/B,T,K,M/body/A star-shaped badge.

(monster: ???)
Mask:100/all/head/You can play with many faces.
Fancy Shield:80/all/arms/A shield with a beautiful crest.

I'm sorry i dont know how to format this, maybe some one could copy it and re-due it better.

By koosen on Wednesday, January 16, 2002 - 09:48 am:

I recently obtained some new accessories so i will give the info on them now.

(beaklon)
CAST:80/all/body/Hard to move, but increases strength.

(Pixie)
HAIRBAND:40/B,T,K,M/head/A fashionable item. Popular with girls.

(Durahan)
SNOW GOGGLES:30/B,K/head/Goggles designed by an unknown inventor.
WING ORNAMENT:80/all/body/A chest ornament with a wing motif.
DURA-ARMS(1):60/B,T,M/arms/Gauntlets designed by unknown inventor.

(Hengar)
DISH:40/all/head/An antenna designed by an unknown inventor.
GREY BOX:60/all/body/A machine of some sort, designed by an unknown inventor.

By dragon knight2300 on Tuesday, March 5, 2002 - 09:31 am:

according to prima the vast majority of all the items and accessories have no effect.

Personaly I think this was just a result of the mistaken belief that mostly young kids play this sort of game so they added a way to make your monster "look cool" thinking that realy mattered.

Its also probably another ploy for the ps2 to try and show off its graphics.

But still it can be amusing and at least now your monster will hopefully not be identical to the monster your fighting:)

Oh also there is the rice bowel for moochi wich i got from the pandora's disk when used before attaining any rank.

By Khift on Sunday, March 17, 2002 - 12:46 pm:

My friend, who used a Naga, purchased a spiked ball and equipped it on it's tail and, as Eagle Fierce said, it seemed to increase the damage dealt by Needle Cutter, which is an attack where the Naga swings it's tail at the enemy. I also noticed that my Tiger gained 'Resistant to heat' when wearing Sunglasses and lived in Morx....

By Eagle Fierce on Sunday, March 17, 2002 - 01:44 pm:

Do you remember what number the Sunglasses were, Khift? I'm personally guessing 4, but clarification is needed for the data (assuming anybody ever updates it >_<)

By Khift on Wednesday, March 20, 2002 - 02:27 pm:

It was 4. I just like to call them sunglasses because of what they look like.

By Dreiz on Wednesday, March 20, 2002 - 09:43 pm:

I tested a cp using the accessories you buy. The "pan's horn" does in fact increase damage although I am not sure if it is a percent or pre-determined. I tested a cp (Bingo) with 765 strength and the tech koro rocket against a dragon (175 pow, 155 def). Without the accessory Bingo did around 660 damage every time, but with the "pan's horn" it did around 700.

By terance on Monday, April 1, 2002 - 08:49 am:

my friend found an arrow for his seuesos head. He had high int. and found it in morX. Gadamon says her monster can find rare items on ventures too.

By Anonymous on Tuesday, April 16, 2002 - 11:33 pm:

By Khift on Saturday, April 20, 2002 - 12:14 pm:

While raising my Joker, Arawn, I gave him a Flame Jewel in hopes of it increasing the damage dealt by Dark Flame. During his entire life, he never lived a week outside of Takrama/Kalaragi, but he acquired "Resists Cold", which I believe was caused by the Flame Jewel. It makes sense, too. The jewel keeps him warm in cold areas, though he never had to use it.

By Kimochi on Tuesday, October 1, 2002 - 10:05 am:

Actually monsters tend to gain "resist cold" and "resist heat" chars when they go through the first stage in life.
